intro: Spermacoce weygaertii, commonly known as the African starfruit or wild starfruit, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, yellow, fleshy fruits that are edible and have a mild, sweet flavor. Spermacoce weygaertii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
